roleset.name: create
roleset.note: GENERATE-V NOTES: Comparison with 'create'. Member of VNcls engender-27, grow-26.2. (from generate.01-v)
GENERATION-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to 'generate.01'. Vn class engender-27 and grow-26.2. Fn class intentionally_create. Framed by Katie. (from generation.01-n)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: But he said they are ``to a large degree, housekeeping,'' although some may generate some disagreement.

example.name: with source/material
example.text: For the last year, Santa Fe Pacific has redirected its real estate operations toward longer-term development of its properties, hurting profits that-1 the parent had generated *trace*-1 in the past from periodic sales from its portfolio.
example.arg: from periodic sales from its portfolio

example.name: more args than you see with most nouns
example.text: mankind 's generation of carbon dioxide through increased combustion of fossil fuels
example.arg: through increased combustion of fossil fuels

example.name: arg 1 only (most common)
example.text: a gene that could lead to a generation of plants possessing a high-production trait
example.arg: of plants possessing a high-production trait
